Subarachnoid haemorrhage

Subarachnoid haemorrhage xxx% aneurysm xxx%traumatic

World Federation of Neurosurgeons Classification:

Haemodynamic management traditionally ‘Triple H’: Hypertensive Hypervolaemic Haemodilution. However, there is little evidence for hypervolaemia and haemodilution may actually be deleterious. Some experts now advocate ‘Single N’ therapy: noradrenaline to maintain MAP > 100.
